duties_responsibilities.duty: Monitor and maintain freight and logistics operations, ensuring adherence to safety and quality policies.
Coordinate loading, unloading, and documentation of freight, providing materials for manufacturing while maintaining inventory levels.
Lead and assist with the training of team members, enforcing safety and quality standards.
Control man-hours, plan and execute daily work, and coordinate activities with other departments for efficient logistics operations.
Seek and develop new processes to improve productivity and customer satisfaction, while ensuring compliance with safety policies.
Provide leadership in creating and maintaining a safe work environment, enforcing safe work practices and achieving safety goals.
Set objectives and standards for team members, providing tools, training, and support, and promoting effective communication and teamwork within the department.
Maintain continual effective communication with associates, perform performance coaching and counseling, and adhere to legal and company policies and procedures.
Perform physical tasks such as lifting, standing for extended periods, bending, reaching, and climbing ladders as required in a manufacturing environment.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent GED preferred.
Prior supervisory experience preferred but not required.
